Description

THE POSITION:

Appointed by the Public Works Director, the Transportation Services Manager oversees the Transportation division consisting of the Transportation Planning, Traffic Operations, and Active Transportation Sections, and is responsible for planning, organizing, and supervising the work of 6 full-time traffic engineering professionals. The Transportation Services Manager, along with the Division team, is responsible for the City’s Master Plan of Arterials Highways, Active Transportation Plan, and Pedestrian Master Plan; designing and maintaining the City’s bicycle and pedestrian infrastructure and preparing layouts, design and specifications for active transportation improvements and traffic signal infrastructure; overseeing capital improvement projects; preparing plans and specifications for the installation and modification of street lights and traffic signals; overseeing the General Plan’s circulation elements and the City’s traffic model, as well as reviewing of development plans, related traffic studies, overseeing major active transportation improvement projects; conferring with City departments, public officials and business and civic leaders in matters relating to traffic issues and represents City staff at various council, commission and committee meetings

Qualifications

The ideal candidate must have five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in the field of traffic engineering and transportation planning, including three (3) years supervisory/management experience. Graduation from a fouryear college or university with major course work in civil engineering, traffic engineering, transportation or related field is required. A Master’s degree in Civil Engineering, Urban Planning, Public Administration, Business Administration, or a related field is highly desirable. Certification as a registered Civil Engineer by the State of California or registration as a Traffic Engineer by the State of California is highly desirable. A
